intro: Ocotea loefgrenii, commonly known as the Pacific Islands ocotea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically glossy and lance-shaped. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by spherical, black berries. Ocotea loefgrenii is often found in lowland and montane forests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
